description.narrative: Stakeholder Effect: The most significant project-level outcome is derived from increased access to finance for MEs and underserved individuals with a focus on women enterprises and micro-housing, particularly in rural areas. Resilience: IFC anticipates that the Project will promote increased resilience, achieved though supporting access to finance for MEs to withstand financial and economic shocks caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. IFC will also support the private sector in the economic recovery process after the crisis, shortening the time for the most vulnerable to return to their previous income generating capacities.

The proposed Project consists of a straight senior loan of up to US$2.5mn, denominated in local currency, to Microcredit company Bailyk Finance LLC (Bailyk Finance or the Company). The proposed investment will be a new FIG Investment engagement with an existing FIG Advisory client. The Project will enable Bailyk to increase access to finance for micro enterprises (MEs) and underserved individuals in rural areas of the KR on sustaining affordable housing finance for low-income individuals and/or financing to women owned MEs. As IFC expands its work in the KR, the proposed investment adds another dimension by providing direct funding to the Company.
